posts.html:
Migrating from MDTP v1 to v2

We knew going into web3 that mistakes are expensive.

We knew things are immutable.

But we hadn't actually run things in production.

Here's what we tried and how it went wrong.

<screenshot of code with payable instead of onlyOwner>

We were looking out for how people could "hack" the contract.

We tried to ensure that we could bypass our rules when needed.

We didn't think to add a "pause" so that nothing could move in the contract in case something went wrong.

We *almost* forgot to add a withdraw function which meant money would be locked in forever.

We added loads of tests to check things worked as we thought.

We didn't know about upgradable contracts.

I didn't realise we spent ~4x more on deployment than we should have because i hadn't enabled compiler optimisation.

The problem

I made a typo in one of the functions. It means anyone can mint for free. It still costs gas so nobody is gonna do it too much and our mint price was still only 0.01eth so it's not like they are gonna run off with loads of money.

The solution

Nice read on upgrade-ability: https://betterprogramming.pub/not-all-smart-contracts-are-immutable-create-upgradable-smart-contracts-e4e933b7b8a9

We deployed a new version. We added a bunch of stuff we wanted from the old one - cheaper minting and making it pausable, a new ERC spceification. We also removed a bunch of functions we never used.

Migration from v1 to v2

A key challenge is migrating the old owners to the new contract. It works like this:
in the original contract lets say we have these tokens minted already:

#1 -> 0x123
#711 -> 0x456
#712 -> 0x456
#811 -> 0x456
#812 -> 0x456
#9011 -> 0x789
#9012 -> 0x789

so we have 7 tokens minted by three people. in the original contract this affects storage in a few places but the main one is in an array called _owners where it literally has a map from tokenId -> owner as shown above.

Populating this array directly into the new contract would not only be expensive but it would also break a number of ERC721 standards, most notably it would not automatically send out the Transfer event that many dapps rely on to monitor tokens.

All-in-all transposing the ownership from the old contract to the new would cost way over $50k at current eth prices. This is too much of a cost for us to bear as a young project.

The next ideal situation would be to point to the old contract for old tokens and to the new contract for new owners. However, we don't have a way to stop people from minting in the old contract so we would have to know exactly which tokens are part of the old batch and tell the new contract to point to the old ones for those.

The alternative we've designed is that the new looks to the old contract for a hardcoded list of tokens that we will specify. To do this when we initialise the contract we will set the old contract as the owner of the tokenIds that have already been minted.

This will cost us ~10k.

Unfortunately we haven't found a cheaper way of doing this so it's a cost we will have to bear.

posts.html:
Hereâ€™s a slap in the face: no one cares about your NFT. (Yet)

And hereâ€™s your tissue: focus on building a community first, art second.

Designing and minting your NFT is exciting. But to make it successful with high engagement and a positive ROI, a strong community will be the key to selling your work and growing your project.

So whether youâ€™re an NFT buyer or aspiring seller, itâ€™s high time you learn what it takes to grow one successfully. At Million Dollar Token Page, weâ€™re going to cover everything you need to know about NFT communities and showcase leading examples on how to drive growth.

Why are communities so essential for an NFTâ€™s success?

Think about what a startup needs to lift off: Investors, an action team, and a community to consume the offering.

For a blockchain startup (NFT creators), the community does all three. Except, interested parties not only support the project (e.g., on social media or with money), they often have a stake in the project themselves and build on the NFT (develop applications around it).

A crypto community essentially gives your NFT a purpose. The symbiotic relationship can then snowball into a successful ecosystem around your NFT, with the community being the lifeline.

Example of community in action: CryptoKitties

CryptoKitty started as an NFT art collectible of virtual cats. But since this token is extensible, the owners and community members were able to actively engage in developing add-on applications around the NFT concept.

And born was the KittyVerse: a digital world of gamified applications for CyptoKitty NFTs, where people can use their Kitties to duel, have their genes explained, breed with other Kitties, and be used as collateral for fungible ERC-20 tokens.

All these different abilities in the KittyVerse demonstrate how an engaged community can give life to an NFT through some creative thought and code.

What you need for an NFT project that stands out

The most successful NFT projects have some things in common â€“ below are some best practices and pro tips you can implement for your own NFT project.

  1. A collaborative team with different skillsets (graphic design, programming, community outreach and marketing). Instead of spreading yourself too thin and compromising quality, find a group of like-minded and skilled NFT enthusiasts to tackle different areas of your project.
  2. Especially someone to truly engage the community. Developers & designers wonâ€™t have time to answer questions and fulfill public roles full-time. NFTs are a new space with a lot of naivety, and having someone who knows what theyâ€™re talking about can be magnetic for new members who need some reassurance and certainty.
  3. High-quality & original art â€“ whether you hire someone or do it yourself, devote a lot of time and passion to your art. With creative design and unique storytelling, youâ€™ll knock meme competitors out of the park (although memes can still be important for storytelling).

Junkyard Dogs (JYD), for example, were one of the first to coin NFT animations that received great social feedback for their novelty and appeal.

A compelling story. Itâ€™s easier to build an interested community and fanbase around your NFT when you give it lore. Speak on its origin, what it stands for, and your overarching vision. An NFT with a creative story is an NFT loved by the people. Here's a great Twitter thread on how Web3 changed the game for artists:

Simple on-chain production for a derivative ecosystem (open NFT playground): communities can only engage with your NFT if you mint it on-chain (where your data is open-source and accessible) to enable its extensibility (everyoneâ€™s ability to develop supplementary applications). A pro tip is to keep your NFT as simple as possible to allow others to build on it.

For example, hereâ€™s Loot, an NFT project comprised of 8,000 unique "bags" of RPG-style adventuring equipment. By giving the community a simpler NFT, people had more drawing-room for its applications.

For instance, you couldnâ€™t break loot bags into separate adventure items, so LootMart was proactively developed by the community to do just that.

  1. Consider Tokenomics â€“ the future of your NFT is the single most difficult thing to change later on (e.g. scarcity to abundance or deflationary to inflationary tokens). Flesh out the answers to critical questions beforehand.
  2. How many tokens will you launch right now?
  3. Will there be more tokens issued later on?
  4. Will there be a treasury?
  5. Will there be scarcity? Abundance?
  6. What should be the token-purchasing limits? Without a limit per transaction, you could trigger gas wars where some people aggressively buy a considerable percentage of the total NFT supply. This limits ownership diversity and can manipulate the NFTâ€™s value â€“ not a good look for your community. The more unique wallet holders you have, the larger and more diverse your community is.

Another example: Nouns DAO

They publish 1 noun a day for auction â€“ and all proceeds go to the treasury governed by Nouns holders. The Noun team also gets 1 noun every 10 days. With this structured plan, theyâ€™ve created a token thatâ€™s scarce right now, abundant later on, with a treasure that is continuously funded to invest in the Nounâ€™s ecosystem.

  1. A highly-engaged community (surprise, surprise). Like we said, a community will give your NFT a purpose by creating applications around it and supporting it on social media. Without one, youâ€™ll be a sitting duck. In the next few sections, youâ€™ll learn more about rallying a community.

Define your audience

As with any startup, your new NFT needs a product-market fit. That starts with defining your target audience â€“ who will enjoy your art? Who will yearn for more?

Your first mistake would be to target everyone. The blockchain and dapp environments are still in very new and early growth stages. Managing crypto wallets, private keys, or dealing with gas are big barriers to entry for newbies. And most people think NFT art pieces are stupid because they donâ€™t understand it.

So your first audience filter would be blockchain knowledgeability. Target blockchain-informed audiences who can appreciate the vision of decentralization, your community-building efforts, and take part in product development.

Then, youâ€™ll want to find people interested in your art. Junkyard Dogs (JYD) found success in their Ethereum blockchain-based generative project with dog lovers with a passion for art and utility.

Set a vision to unify your community

For an NFT community â€“ for any community really â€“ there has to be a shared vision that unifies its members. There canâ€™t be a community without an idea that people believe in.

So for your NFT, what are people coming together for? Whatâ€™s the underlying passion? Chances are, if you have a hobby or interest that inspired you to create an NFT, thereâ€™s probably a community on the internet with like-minded people.

NBA Top Shot from Dapper Labsâ€™ is a prime example. Itâ€™s centered around collecting top highlights in NBA history. This gives basketball fans an opportunity to come together and show off their owned pieces of on-court action.

To throw another inspiring example: Pakistani-born Maliha Abidi leads an NFT community called â€œWomen Riseâ€ whose core mission is to empower women (activists, artists, scientists, coders) and drive their engagement in crypto.

Choose your social media channels.

Picking the right social channels is crucial because thatâ€™s where you build your audience. Below is a master list of the most popular communication channels for NFT communities alike. But before you start your outreach efforts, identify which sites your people prefer â€“ and stick to that.

  • Twitter. Twitter is like the silicon valley x wall street for NFTs. Every NFT-related thing buzzes there first. So dust off your Twitter account and start stalking #NFT feeds â€“ follow people, leave kind comments, join space sessions, repost for bonus points, and share updates on your NFT project.
  • Discord is another fan-favorite that has evolved from a gaming-first platform to a more encompassing place for blockchain startups. With so many server customization features, NFT creators can nurture their communities in a truly personalized space. Most NFT communities have a dedicated server.
  • Rocket.Chat is a popular open-source alternative to Slack, especially for developers. It can act as a singular hub for community-building and team communications with so many useful features built-in like multi-channel support.
  • Reddit. Tap into a wider audience with greater room for free-flowing discussions, community support, and sharing NFT subreddits.
  • Telegram. The NFT space is big on security. So this end-to-end encrypted video calling, messaging, and file sharing platform is particularly popular in the blockchain ecosystem. You can securely communicate one-on-one or in a group chat in real-time and build meaningful community relationships.
  • LinkedIn is your place to connect with professionals and companies outside your digital space to create unique business development partnerships (like when Visa bought CryptoPunk). This can be your chance to build a good brand image and legitimize your NFT digital assets.
  • Clubhouse. NFTs seem to be all that Clubhouse users can talk about right now. Try getting an invitation to Clubhouse so you can listen (and talk) to the industryâ€™s most knowledgeable insiders and bounce ideas with excited enthusiasts.
  • Bitcointalk is the perfect platform for releasing exciting news about your NFT and building the buzz through announcement posts and the like.

Focus on delivering consistent value

Now that youâ€™ve decided on the social platforms to grow your audience, itâ€™s time to focus on the value youâ€™re putting out, while worrying less about ROI in the beginning. People wonâ€™t respond to a stranger shilling to them.

Here are some pointers on how to deliver consistent value and build a good name for yourself in the community:

  • Support and connect with other NFT artists and enthusiasts to cross-pollinate ideas and communities. From liking a post to asking interesting questions, find ways to get involved and drive conversation. People will start recognizing your name and be more willing to work with you.
  • Often you may connect with some great insiders from different talents. In JYDâ€™s case, their versatile team of 8 (graphic designers, developers, PR) started as individual NFT collectors and crypto enthusiasts who banded together with a shared vision.
  • Pay attention to humor. Make people laugh â€“ everyone loves funny stuff. The fact is that NFTs are the hot-topic meme of the internet right now, and a successful community knows how to embrace that. Itâ€™s much easier to engage an audience with compelling NFT-related stories and memes on social media.
  • Get creative with engagement methods. Find ways to incentivize users to follow you or join your server. For instance, through proof of attendance protocols (giveaways), creators can award badges or NFTs to early birds in your community. JYD did a giveaway where the first 500 Twitter & 500 Discord followers were eligible to apply for exclusive badges. People love free value.
  • Cool example with Loot: As discussed before, a simple NFT is better for a derivative ecosystem. Will Papper happily made a no-condition application called Adventure Gold ($AGLD), used to buy voting power and governance features for the Loot NFT project, and in future applications, will likely be seen as in-game currency.
  • Look for community-building opportunities outside the digital space. With mainstream brands and organizations looking at the space with eager eyes, successful NFT influencers seek partnerships to help legitimize their community and grow faster. Adidas, for example, acquired RTFKT Studios (a virtual shoe company).

How MDTP helps highlight your community

NFT creators worldwide can buy a piece of the web page and show off their amazing NFTs and link back to their content.

The bigger your block, the more visible your creation on the page. The great thing is that your NFTs, being on the Ethereum network, are immutable (on-chain forever, i.e, there to stay).

As the site continues to grow in popularity, youâ€™ll have more eyes and traffic on your creation. You even have the option to resell your block of pixels for a profit.

With this system, MDTP allows NFT community members to share their work, grow their communities, and be a part of early crypto history.

Successful NFTs have engaged communities

By now, it should be clear that you absolutely need to build a revolving community around your NFT for it to be successful.

Fortunately, now you know what goes into a successful launch, where to start your outreach, and how to deliver consistent value to scale your community. You can always treat this guide like your handbook and bookmark it for later.

[https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2021/oct/11/day-of-the-girl-is-critical-but-support-is-needed-year-round-say-campaigners] 
called â€œWomen Rise [https://twitter.com/womenrisenft?lang=ar]â€ whose core
mission is to empower women (activists, artists, scientists, coders) and drive
their engagement in crypto.

Choose your social media channels.
Picking the right social channels is crucial because thatâ€™s where you build your
audience. Below is a master list of the most popular communication channels for
NFT communities alike. But before you start your outreach efforts, identify
which sites your people prefer â€“ and stick to that.

 * Twitter. Twitter is like the silicon valley x wall street for NFTs. Every
   NFT-related thing buzzes there first. So dust off your Twitter account and
   start stalking #NFT feeds â€“ follow people, leave kind comments, join space
   sessions, repost for bonus points, and share updates on your NFT project.
 * Discord is another fan-favorite that has evolved from a gaming-first platform
   to a more encompassing place for blockchain startups. With so many server
   customization features, NFT creators can nurture their communities in a truly
   personalized space. Most NFT communities have a dedicated server.
 * Rocket.Chat is a popular open-source alternative to Slack, especially for
   developers. It can act as a singular hub for community-building and team
   communications with so many useful features built-in like multi-channel
   support.
 * Reddit. Tap into a wider audience with greater room for free-flowing
   discussions, community support, and sharing NFT subreddits.
 * Telegram. The NFT space is big on security. So this end-to-end encrypted
   video calling, messaging, and file sharing platform is particularly popular
   in the blockchain ecosystem. You can securely communicate one-on-one or in a
   group chat in real-time and build meaningful community relationships.
 * LinkedIn is your place to connect with professionals and companies outside
   your digital space to create unique business development partnerships (like
   when Visa bought CryptoPunk
   [https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/23/visa-buys-cryptopunk-nft-for-150000.html]).
   This can be your chance to build a good brand image and legitimize your NFT
   digital assets.
 * Clubhouse. NFTs seem to be all that Clubhouse users can talk about right now.
   Try getting an invitation to Clubhouse so you can listen (and talk) to the
   industryâ€™s most knowledgeable insiders and bounce ideas with excited
   enthusiasts.
 * Bitcointalk is the perfect platform for releasing exciting news about your
   NFT and building the buzz through announcement posts and the like.

Focus on delivering consistent value
Now that youâ€™ve decided on the social platforms to grow your audience, itâ€™s time
to focus on the value youâ€™re putting out, while worrying less about ROI in the
beginning. People wonâ€™t respond to a stranger shilling to them.

Here are some pointers on how to deliver consistent value and build a good name
for yourself in the community:

 * Support and connect with other NFT artists and enthusiasts to cross-pollinate
   ideas and communities. From liking a post to asking interesting questions,
   find ways to get involved and drive conversation. People will start
   recognizing your name and be more willing to work with you.
 * Often you may connect with some great insiders from different talents. In
   JYDâ€™s case, their versatile team of 8 (graphic designers, developers, PR)
   started as individual NFT collectors and crypto enthusiasts who banded
   together with a shared vision.
 * Pay attention to humor. Make people laugh â€“ everyone loves funny stuff. The
   fact is that NFTs are the hot-topic meme of the internet right now, and a
   successful community knows how to embrace that. Itâ€™s much easier to engage an
   audience with compelling NFT-related stories and memes on social media.
 * Get creative with engagement methods. Find ways to incentivize users to
   follow you or join your server. For instance, through proof of attendance
   protocols (giveaways), creators can award badges or NFTs to early birds in
   your community. JYD did a giveaway where the first 500 Twitter & 500 Discord
   followers were eligible to apply for exclusive badges. People love free
   value.
 * Cool example with Loot: As discussed before, a simple NFT is better for a
   derivative ecosystem. Will Papper
   [https://twitter.com/willpapper/status/1433243941449568259?lang=en] happily
   made a no-condition application called Adventure Gold ($AGLD), used to buy
   voting power and governance features for the Loot NFT project, and in future
   applications, will likely be seen as in-game currency.

 * Look for community-building opportunities outside the digital space. With
   mainstream brands and organizations looking at the space with eager eyes,
   successful NFT influencers seek partnerships to help legitimize their
   community and grow faster. Adidas, for example, acquired RTFKT Studios
   [https://www.theverge.com/22833369/nike-rtfkt-nft-sneaker-shoe-metaverse-company] 
   (a virtual shoe company).

How MDTP helps highlight your community
NFT creators worldwide can buy a piece of the web page and show off their
amazing NFTs and link back to their content.

The bigger your block, the more visible your creation on the page. The great
thing is that your NFTs, being on the Ethereum network, are immutable (on-chain
forever, i.e, there to stay).

As the site continues to grow in popularity, youâ€™ll have more eyes and traffic
on your creation. You even have the option to resell your block of pixels for a
profit.

With this system, MDTP allows NFT community members to share their work, grow
their communities, and be a part of early crypto history.

Successful NFTs have engaged communities
By now, it should be clear that you absolutely need to build a revolving
community around your NFT for it to be successful.

Fortunately, now you know what goes into a successful launch, where to start
your outreach, and how to deliver consistent value to scale your community. You
can always treat this guide like your handbook and bookmark it for later.

posts.html:
NFT's (Non-Fungible Tokens) are all the rage right now and for good reason.

They're unique, digital assets that can be used in a variety of ways. But if you're new to the NFT scene, navigating the marketing and promotion of your tokens can be tough and lonely. You might question why itâ€™s worth your time in the first place.

At the Million Dollar Token Page, we're going to show you why NFT marketing is absolutely crucial and share everything you need to do to get started on the right foot.

Ready? Let's get started.

What is an NFT?

An NFT is a non-fungible token, which is a digital certificate of ownership for a unique cryptographic asset that cannot be interchanged with something else.

Just like how your momâ€™s DNA and consciousness canâ€™t be replicated to build a second mom, a non-fungible token has its own set of digital code on the blockchain that canâ€™t be replicated or replaced either.

You might associate an NFT with funky-looking monkey avatars, but really, it can be anything from a contract, to music, a video clip of an important moment, or whatever else that may benefit from a â€œpatient zeroâ€ stamp.

No matter how many people screenshot it, the creatorâ€™s crypto wallet address canâ€™t be faked or stolen â€“ and it always ties back to that original NFT.

Why is marketing so crucial for your NFTâ€™s success?

Without NFT marketing, your project is a sitting duck.

Whether youâ€™re looking to sell your NFT for the highest bid or want to encourage decentralized applications around your NFT concept, to do something with your digital asset and give it value, youâ€™ll need interested buyers and supporters for your NFT to succeed â€“ a community.

You can attract and build that community through various NFT marketing and advertising initiatives.

A strategic and well thought-out NFT marketing strategy will generate hype and support for your NFT project, allowing it to grow and be auctioned for higher bids.

1. Identify your target audience

It might be tempting to market your NFT to everyone anywhere. Donâ€™t.

Like with any product, you need to target specific people or youâ€™ll be wasting a lot of marketing resources. The fact is, most people donâ€™t understand NFTs and think theyâ€™re stupid. Newbies might also see managing crypto wallets, private keys, or dealing with gas as big barriers to entry.

You want to start with blockchain-informed audiences who can truly understand and appreciate your community-building efforts and NFT development. Within that population, you need to identify your niche and rally like-minded enthusiasts.

For example, the owner of Coffee Bros, Dan Hunnewell, created Crypto Baristas to rally entrepreneurial caffeine-lovers who appreciate art. Or take the MekaVerse, a community of fans centered around the Japanese Mecha bots.

Once youâ€™ve identified your target audience, you now have direction for your strategies and outreach channels.

2. Determine the best outreach channels for your audience

Choosing the right social channels is crucial because that's where you'll build your audience. Weâ€™ve compiled a list of the most popular communication channels for successful NFT communities â€“ but make sure to find the best one for your niche.

  • Discord is a fan-favorite for blockchain startups. NFT creators have access to many customization features allowing them to cultivate communities in a truly customized space.
  • Reddit. Tap into a wider audience with greater room for free-flowing discussions, community support, and sharing NFT subreddits.
  • Twitter. The NFT world buzzes here first. Get your Twitter account up to speed and stalk #NFT feeds from where you can follow people, join space sessions, spark discussions, and share your NFT updates.
  • Rocket.Chat is an open-source alternative to Slack, especially for developers. With so many useful features built-in, such as multi-channel support, it can function as a one-stop shop for community-building and team communications.
  • Telegram. Security is a big deal in the NFT space. So Telegramâ€™s end-to-end encrypted video calling, messaging, and file sharing is especially popular for group and one-on-one chats.
  • Bitcointalk is the perfect place to release exciting news about your NFT and create a buzz with announcement posts and the like.
  • LinkedIn. By connecting with professionals and companies outside your digital space, you can develop unique business partnerships to build your brand image, get people of different skillsets to work with you and legitimize your NFT digital assets.
  • Clubhouse. Clubhouse users seem to be talking exclusively about NFTs right now. If you want to get an insider's perspective on the industry and bounce ideas with enthusiasts, join Clubhouse where you will be able to hear from the experts.

3. Feed every stage of the buyer journey

The buyerâ€™s journey is more complicated than some people may think. It doesnâ€™t just begin and end with a purchase. Itâ€™s an active process that requires your presence in many steps before the purchase.

From an NFT marketerâ€™s perspective, the funnel includes:

  1. Awareness of the NFT space â€“ when a prospect recognizes the opportunities for creating, buying, and selling NFTs.
  2. Consideration of NFT items â€“ when the prospect knows enough about the space to start comparing different NFT creators and purchase methods.
  3. Purchase of the NFT (Conversion) â€“ when a prospect decides to purchase the desired NFT.
  4. Nurture â€“ NFT creatorâ€™s responsibility to keep purchaser and other community members engaged to grow the community collectively.

Now letâ€™s talk about smart NFT marketing strategies you can use at each step of the funnel.

How to drive awareness for your NFT

This will be the most extensive step of the bunch. Here are some ways to promote awareness about NFTs, their potential, along with your brand and project.

  • Creative NFT boards â€“ NFT creators and communities can exhibit their art and content on popular sites like the Million Dollar Token Page, by buying pixel blocks as screen real estate. These give your project a lot of exposure and free convertible traffic.
  • Consider informational videos, blog content, and social media posts to introduce NFTs and the process, cover who you are, how to leverage NFT marketplaces, and hook users with cool stats (how much a recent NFT sold for). Through content marketing, NFT enthusiasts and beginners become familiar with your brand thatâ€™s ever-so-kindly supplying such quality content.
  • Podcasts â€“ Monthly podcast listeners have also grown 61.5% since 2018. Almost 60% of Americans listen to podcasts now. You could take this opportunity to join the early-movers in starting NFT and Crypto podcasts. Alternatively, you can guest on another podcast to widen your reach and build credibility.
  • Forums & communities â€“ adding value to discussions on Reddit, Discord, Telegram, and even Clubhouse are great ways to get your name familiar with community members and namedrop your projects to drive awareness.
  • You can take this a step further and host AMA sessions to feed the ever-growing curiosity in such a novel and uncertain space.
  • Influencer collabs â€“ leveraging audiences of fellow NFT influencers can increase your NFT projectâ€™s exposure while building credibility for your personal brand. You can find these people on Twitter (e.g., space sessions), discussion forums, and even listicles.
  • Incentivizing referrals â€“ another great way to establish awareness for your brand is by granting special benefits to early adopters or promoters. For instance, if you want more discord members, you could offer investors early ownership access to an NFT, which allows them to avoid competitive drops.

How to influence consideration for your NFT

Before we start this section, itâ€™s important to remember that the points from the last section can strongly influence peopleâ€™s consideration for your NFT as well. All of them increase your credibility and instill trust in the consumer, increasing the chances that they pick you.

Hereâ€™s a quick recap of the points we already covered:

  • NFT boards like Million Dollar Token Page
  • Content marketing (blog posts, videos, podcasts, and social media posts)
  • Podcasts
  • Forums & communities
  • Influencer collaborations
  • Incentivized referrals

In addition to those tricks, here are some fantastic strategies that you can use to influence consideration for your NFT.

  • Search engine optimization (SEO) â€“ 75.7% of clicks go to the first four organic results on the search engine results page. Strong NFT brand visibility and activity (e.g. content marketing) on search engines is a winning method for attracting lots of web surfers to learn more and consider your NFT.
  • Since SEO is a data-driven domain that needs expertise, it can be smart to hire professional SEO content marketing services who do the heavy lifting for you.
  • An attractive website with trust elements â€“ As lucrative NFTs can be, the space is also notorious for scams and hacks. Itâ€™s a good idea to set the right impression with a professional website coupled with social proof elements that foster trust to remove any doubts and uncertainties from the get-go.
  • This could be like the size of your discord community, showing off dapps built around your NFT concept, announcing partnerships with credible influencers or companies, and so on.
  • FAQs â€“ when prospects are considering your NFT, theyâ€™ll likely have questions they need answered. A dedicated FAQ section or page helps them make an informed decision. Without one, you may find prospects turned off from the ambiguity and opt for a competitor who has answers.
  • Review sites â€“ alongside your own siteâ€™s standing, itâ€™s also important to consider what others are saying about you. Thereâ€™s an obvious bias on a creatorâ€™s personal site and users know this â€“ so theyâ€™ll also read opinions on third-party platforms.
  • Mint your NFT on-chain â€“ doing so invites fellow community members to access its data and create dapps around your NFT concept. That, in turn, will attract even more people and snowball a loyal community.

Conversion

The prospect is getting warmer and warmer in purchasing your NFT at this point. Now youâ€™ll need to determine the best place to sell your NFTs. Depending on what it is exactly, your NFT marketplace will vary.

Here are your options for NFT marketplaces to add your listing to:

  • OpenSea - worldâ€™s largest NFT trading platform. Popular categories include art, music, domain names, and virtual worlds.
  • Crypto.com - a platform is best suited for selling art, sports collectibles, and celebrity items.
  • Myth Market - a great place to find unique trading cards.
  • SuperRare - focuses specifically on digital art. Ether is used for transactions, and you can connect your Ethereum wallet to your account. .
  • Rarible - art, photography, music, games, and metaverses. You can interact with the community through native discussion boards and connect various crypto wallets.
  • NFT Hunters - each day, NFT Hunters selects the next best NFT and de-fi projects and delivers them directly to subscribers' inboxes. You can apply to be featured in their emails by sending an email to team@defihunters.com.
  • MakersPlace - you can sell digital art creations through MakersPlace's storefront for free. Each time you make a sale, MakersPlace will charge you 15% plus 2.9% for credit card sales. Payments can be made with credit cards or cryptocurrencies.
  • Solanart - the NFTs sold on Solanart include art, games, and metaverses. To interact with the marketplace, youâ€™ll need a Solana wallet like Phantom or Sollet. They also take a 3% fee on marketplace transactions.

Nurture your NFT community

If you want a truly successful NFT that performs long-term, you canâ€™t forget about buyers post-transaction (or even before they make the purchase). You need to proactively develop your community through consistent engagement and value propositions for user retention.

Here are some ways:

  • Member-only community â€“ An exclusive hub for enthusiasts of your NFT concept including dapp developers, investors, and participating community members. You can grow this population on platforms like Twitter or Discord, where you could offer exclusive perks and offers to keep them happy.
  • Online events and offline meetups â€“ If youâ€™ve built dapps around your NFT concept, like virtual gaming worlds and activities, you can get creative and hold tournaments for championship prizes. Or, you can hold live Q&A sessions, show unique blockchain technology demonstrations, brainstorm dapps, and share updates or news to keeps users engaged. Organize IRL meetups allow community members to get to know each other and socialize outside the confines of the virtual space. You can then incentivize participation through POAPs (more on these shortly).
  • Email marketing campaigns â€“ Emails can also be a nice intimate way to keep in touch with leads and community members. You can provide them with updates on your projects, share news in the NFT space, and provide exclusive offers as you may on discord channels. That said, you need to be a little careful with this, as some of your privacy-minded members might not like to use this medium to interact!

Drive awareness, consideration, & engagement with POAPs

Proof of attendance protocols (POAPs) is a type of NFT that acts as a â€œbadgeâ€ or â€œsymbolâ€ for the collector, commemorating their involvement in a special event. You can repurpose them for many areas of the funnel like:

  • For awareness and consideration, you could do a POAP giveaway to, say, the first 100 people to join your community or event, which would act as an â€œearly birdâ€ status symbol for the rest of your communityâ€™s life. This can spread the word about events youâ€™re hosting and encourage others to get in on your incentives for POAP holders.
  • For community engagement, you might use a POAP like a â€œmerit badgeâ€ to award community members for doing something (like building a dapp around your NFT or being active in community channels). These collectors can be subject to special offers and privileges for their contributions, also being an inspiration for other community members.

Itâ€™s best to create your POAP a few days before an event due to the 24-hour approval process. You can make a 500x500px POAP design on free sites like Canva, use photoshop, or hire professional designers on Fiverr to do it for you.

After youâ€™re done, youâ€™re ready to launch it by filling out some preliminary info first.

Setting up your marketing drop for success

  1. Add your drop to an NFT calendar. These are great platforms to promote your release with all the finer details like an NFT description, data and time of the drop, the marketplace of your drop, and an official link to your release.
  1. Flesh out an engaging teaser. People donâ€™t care about your NFTâ€™s life story. But they might after you entice them with a shorter engaging teaser summarizing the cool parts about your origin and message. If you need help communicating your message, you could hire a qualified copywriter who can create a great story around your NFT.
  2. Start preparing your audience on social media at least two weeks before your NFT drop. Showcase your drop on popular platforms like Twitter, Instagram, and Discord and storytell your inspirations, creative process, and failures to engage your followers.
  3. Try landing featured drops on the marketplace. You can attract more attention and build credibility as a blockchain startup by getting your NFT featured. This type of promotion is organized directly with marketplaces, which have dedicated web pages for featured drops and their details.
  4. Order a PR article about your NFT drop. Partnering with media sites is another great way to build credibility for your new project and get a lot of eyes in front of it fast.

Start showing off your NFT on the Million Dollar Token Page

Hooray! You made it to the end. You should have a solid idea of how to approach your NFT marketing strategy by now. Itâ€™s time to start building a successful NFT loved by the people.

A great way to easily attract lots of eyes and clicks to your NFT project is by securing a sizeable pixel block on the Million Dollar Token Page. You could resell your digital space for a profit later on or keep it as your place in crypto history as the site grows more popular.

You can claim your digital piece of NFT real estate here.

   spread the word about events youâ€™re hosting and encourage others to get in on
   your incentives for POAP holders.
 * For community engagement, you might use a POAP like a â€œmerit badgeâ€ to award
   community members for doing something (like building a dapp around your NFT
   or being active in community channels). These collectors can be subject to
   special offers and privileges for their contributions, also being an
   inspiration for other community members.

Itâ€™s best to create your POAP a few days before an event due to the 24-hour
approval process. You can make a 500x500px POAP design on free sites like Canva
[https://www.canva.com/], use photoshop, or hire professional designers on 
Fiverr
[https://www.fiverr.com/search/gigs?query=design%20POAP&modified_query=design%20pop&source=search_did_you_mean&should_suggest=false&search-autocomplete-original-term=design%20POAP] 
to do it for you.

After youâ€™re done, youâ€™re ready to launch it by filling out some preliminary
info first [https://app.poap.xyz/admin/events/new].

Setting up your marketing drop for success
 1. Add your drop to an NFT calendar [https://nftcal.xyz/]. These are great
    platforms to promote your release with all the finer details like an NFT
    description, data and time of the drop, the marketplace of your drop, and an
    official link to your release.

 1. Flesh out an engaging teaser. People donâ€™t care about your NFTâ€™s life story.
    But they might after you entice them with a shorter engaging teaser
    summarizing the cool parts about your origin and message. If you need help
    communicating your message, you could hire a qualified copywriter who can
    create a great story around your NFT.
 2. Start preparing your audience on social media at least two weeks before your
    NFT drop. Showcase your drop on popular platforms like Twitter, Instagram,
    and Discord and storytell your inspirations, creative process, and failures
    to engage your followers.
 3. Try landing featured drops on the marketplace. You can attract more
    attention and build credibility as a blockchain startup by getting your NFT
    featured. This type of promotion is organized directly with marketplaces,
    which have dedicated web pages for featured drops and their details.
 4. Order a PR article about your NFT drop. Partnering with media sites is
    another great way to build credibility for your new project and get a lot of
    eyes in front of it fast.

Start showing off your NFT on the Million Dollar Token Page
Hooray! You made it to the end. You should have a solid idea of how to approach
your NFT marketing strategy by now. Itâ€™s time to start building a successful NFT
loved by the people.

A great way to easily attract lots of eyes and clicks to your NFT project is by 
securing a sizeable pixel block on the Million Dollar Token Page. You could
resell your digital space for a profit later on or keep it as your place in
crypto history as the site grows more popular.

You can claim your digital piece of NFT real estate here
[https://milliondollartokenpage.com/].

posts.html:
Are you looking to raise the visibility of your NFT collection? Sure, there is Twitter and other social media sites. However, one of the most intriguing ways to show off your NFT collection is through NFT galleries. Whether you are a creator or a collector, there are a number of benefits that an NFT gallery can offer. At Million Dollar Token Page, weâ€™ll delve into the top NFT gallery platforms to use in 2022.

What is an NFT Gallery?

Since NFT galleries are a relatively new concept, you may have never seen one. Think of an NFT gallery as a virtual art gallery where you can show off your NFT collection. You can show off NFTs that you personally own or NFT that you have created.

In some cases, these NFT galleries are displayed in a metaverse where visitors can view your NFTs in a 3-D environment. Currently, there are a number of NFT galleries that offer free and paid options for creators and collectors.

The Benefits of NFTS Galleries

You may be wondering why you should have your own NFT gallery. There are a number of benefits to displaying your NFTs. Hereâ€™s a look at the top three benefits:

1) Show Off Work

Showing off your work can benefit you whether you are a creator or a collector. As a creator, you are able to raise the visibility of your collection and gain more buyers. As a collector, you can potentially increase the value of your work, find buyers and elevate your personal brand.

2) Increase Visibility and Branding

With the dearth of NFT creators and collectors in the current environment, it is important to stand out from the crowd. In fact, we have an in-depth article on how to market, promote and advertise your NFTs. With an NFT gallery, you are able to differentiate yourself from millions of other creators and collectors.

3) Boost Value of NFTs

Finally, you can potentially boost the value of your NFTs by showing off your collection in a controlled environment. This can be particularly advantageous if you want to show off work that will be offered in an NFT marketplace.

NFT galleries VS NFT Marketplaces

In certain ways, an NFT gallery sounds pretty familiar to NFT marketplaces. After all, both platforms show off NFT collections. However, there are some important differences. First, with an NFT gallery, you own and control the environment. Therefore, you can choose the work that is displayed. Along NFT galleries are a great way to engage with your community. An NFT marketplace, on the other hand, shows collections from a number of creators and collections.

Also, you will have to bring visitors to your NFT gallery while NFT marketplaces will generate traffic to your collection. Ultimately, it is a good idea to have your NFT collection displayed in your own NFT gallery while also offering your work on an NFT marketplace.

The Top NFT Galleries

Since NFT galleries are still a relatively new concept, there are a limited number of options. However, early adopters tend to reap the most benefits. Therefore, itâ€™s a smart idea to familiarize yourself with the top NFT galleries that are currently available. The team at Million Dollar Token Page, have selected five top NFT galleries that stand out due to their popularity and other factors:

1). Mynt

Mynt is one of the top NFT galleries which is free to use for both creators and collectors. On Mynt, you can show off individual pieces or bind together complete collections. One of the great features of Mynt is that you can link your work to an NFT marketplace such as Open Sea.

On the front page of the Mynt site, you will also find a list of the top ten collectors. Even if you are not interested in creating your own NFT gallery, you can view the holdings of some of the biggest NFT collectors.

In order to get started, you will need to connect your Metamask wallet. From there, you can create your account and upload your work.

Why Use Mynt?

Right now, Mynt is one of the most popular NFT gallery platforms. The interface is easy to use, free of charge, and allows you to link your NFTs to an NFT marketplace.

2). Spatial

If you are looking to create your NFT gallery in a metaverse environment, then Spatial should be on your list. The 3-D environment is impressive and it creates an immersive environment to show off your NFT collection. Unlike Mynt, there are both free and paid plans for the platform:

  • Free - You can host exhibitions and meet-ups to show off your collection.
  • Pro - This paid plan is for those who want to curate their work in a controlled environment. This plan is $25 per month.
  • Special Event - If you are planning to host a special event, the platform invites you to contact them. This is not an additional cost beyond the Pro level.

To get started with Spatial, you will either need to connect your Metamask wallet or have a supported browser. Currently Spatial works for Google, Apple, and Microsoft Windows users.


Why use Spatial?

Spatial is going to be a smart choice for those who are a little more advanced in their NFT collection experience. If you are looking to launch a major NFT project or if you have a large NFT collection, then taking advantage of the platformâ€™s 3-D gallery environment may make sense.

3) Crytovoxels

For those who want to create an NFT gallery in a pure metaverse environment, Cryptovoxels is going to be a smart choice. Unlike the previous two entries, Cryptovoxels is not solely dedicated to hosting NFT galleries. Instead, Cyrtovoxels is an Ethereum based metaverse that allows the creation of NFT galleries.

One of the big advantages of Crytovoxels is that the platform is free to use for NFT gallery creators. However, there is an option to purchase a parcel of land on the platform if you have a more extensive fanbase. With your own parcel of land, you can have engineers custom build your own NFT gallery.

To get started with Crytovoxels, simply go to the siteâ€™s homepage and create a free space. If you have a large following, you can also go to the homepage and purchase a parcel of land.

Why use Cryptovoxels?

Because Cryptovoxels is more of an open metaverse community, you will likely draw more visitors to your gallery. Also, the fact that this 3-D gallery is free to use means that it will be much more beginner-friendly.

4). Decentraland

Decentraland is one of the largest metaverses platforms available and one of the top places to create your own NFT art gallery. This Ethereum based metaverse platform is already popular with NFT collectors and creators. In fact, the auction house Sotheby's recently opened a virtual gallery on the platform.

With Decentralnd, you can create your own NFT art gallery or you can have your work displayed in one of the many already built galleries. The big advantage of Decentraland is that it is already a popular destination for NFT collectors and creators. Therefore, it is well worth your time to show off your work on this platform.

To get started with Decentraland, visit their homepage and connect your Ethereum wallet. If you are not ready to open an NFT gallery or display your work, you can always browse Decentraland as a guest.

Why choose Decentraland?

Decentraland is already popular with NFT creators and collectors. Therefore, you are likely to find an audience right away on the platform. Also, you will have the ability to either have your work displayed or create your own NFT gallery.

5). Unstoppable Domains NFT Art Gallery

Unstoppable Domains is an NFT art gallery platform where you can replace crypto addresses with domain names. This can make it easy for you to show off and display your NFT collection. Now, Unstoppable Domains has gone one step further by creating their own NFT gallery feature. When you purchase a domain, you will be able to set up the NFT gallery feature and show off your collection.

To get started, you will have to connect your Metamask wallet to their .crypto domain. From there, purchase a domain that will connect to your NFTâ€™s crypto address. From there, you will be able to set up your NFT galley.

Why choose Unstoppable Domains?

One of the biggest advantages of Unstoppable Domains is that you can create an easily recognizable address to point people to your NFT gallery. Also, the domain is inexpensive and there are no renewal fees. If you are looking to get viewers from a social media post to your NFT gallery, then using Unstoppable Domains is a smart choice.

Finding the Best NFT Gallery for Your Work

As you can see, there are a number of interesting virtual NFT gallery platforms available. You may be interested in displaying your collection in one or more of these NFT galleries. Also, you should consider displaying one or more of your work on the Million Dollar Token Page.

Consider the pros and cons of each option before you commit any time or money towards the creator of these galleries. Additionally, be sure to look out for new NFT galleries that should emerge over the next few months. Chances are that you will have many more options available as NFT galleries grow in popularity.

Since NFT galleries are a relatively new concept, you may have never seen one.
Think of an NFT gallery as a virtual art gallery where you can show off your NFT
collection. You can show off NFTs that you personally own or NFT that you have
created. 

In some cases, these NFT galleries are displayed in a metaverse where visitors
can view your NFTs in a 3-D environment. Currently, there are a number of NFT
galleries that offer free and paid options for creators and collectors.

The Benefits of NFTS Galleries
You may be wondering why you should have your own NFT gallery. There are a
number of benefits to displaying your NFTs. Hereâ€™s a look at the top three
benefits:

1) Show Off Work
Showing off your work can benefit you whether you are a creator or a collector.
As a creator, you are able to raise the visibility of your collection and gain
more buyers. As a collector, you can potentially increase the value of your
work, find buyers and elevate your personal brand. 

2) Increase Visibility and Branding
With the dearth of NFT creators and collectors in the current environment, it is
important to stand out from the crowd. In fact, we have an in-depth article on 
how to market, promote and advertise your NFTs
[https://blog.milliondollartokenpage.com/market-promote-advertise-your-nft/].
With an NFT gallery, you are able to differentiate yourself from millions of
other creators and collectors. 

3) Boost Value of NFTs
Finally, you can potentially boost the value of your NFTs by showing off your
collection in a controlled environment. This can be particularly advantageous if
you want to show off work that will be offered in an NFT marketplace. 

NFT galleries VS NFT Marketplaces
In certain ways, an NFT gallery sounds pretty familiar to NFT marketplaces.
After all, both platforms show off NFT collections. However, there are some
important differences. First, with an NFT gallery, you own and control the
environment. Therefore, you can choose the work that is displayed. Along NFT
galleries are a great way to engage with your community
[https://blog.milliondollartokenpage.com/build-and-engage-nft-community/]. An
NFT marketplace, on the other hand, shows collections from a number of creators
and collections. 

Also, you will have to bring visitors to your NFT gallery while NFT marketplaces
will generate traffic to your collection. Ultimately, it is a good idea to have
your NFT collection displayed in your own NFT gallery while also offering your
work on an NFT marketplace. 

The Top NFT Galleries
Since NFT galleries are still a relatively new concept, there are a limited
number of options. However, early adopters tend to reap the most benefits.
Therefore, itâ€™s a smart idea to familiarize yourself with the top NFT galleries
that are currently available. The team at Million Dollar Token Page
[https://milliondollartokenpage.com/], have selected five top NFT galleries that
stand out due to their popularity and other factors: 

1). Mynt [https://mynt.la]
Mynt is one of the top NFT galleries which is free to use for both creators and
collectors. On Mynt, you can show off individual pieces or bind together
complete collections. One of the great features of Mynt is that you can link
your work to an NFT marketplace such as Open Sea.

On the front page of the Mynt site, you will also find a list of the top ten
collectors. Even if you are not interested in creating your own NFT gallery, you
can view the holdings of some of the biggest NFT collectors. 

In order to get started, you will need to connect your Metamask wallet. From
there, you can create your account and upload your work.

Why Use Mynt?
Right now, Mynt is one of the most popular NFT gallery platforms. The interface
is easy to use, free of charge, and allows you to link your NFTs to an NFT
marketplace.

2). Spatial [https://spatial.io]
If you are looking to create your NFT gallery in a metaverse environment, then
Spatial should be on your list. The 3-D environment is impressive and it creates
an immersive environment to show off your NFT collection. Unlike Mynt, there are
both free and paid plans for the platform:

 * Free - You can host exhibitions and meet-ups to show off your collection.
 * Pro - This paid plan is for those who want to curate their work in a
   controlled environment. This plan is $25 per month.
 * Special Event - If you are planning to host a special event, the platform
   invites you to contact them. This is not an additional cost beyond the Pro
   level. 

To get started with Spatial, you will either need to connect your Metamask
wallet or have a supported browser. Currently Spatial works for Google, Apple,
and Microsoft Windows users. 


Why use Spatial?


Spatial is going to be a smart choice for those who are a little more advanced
in their NFT collection experience. If you are looking to launch a major NFT
project or if you have a large NFT collection, then taking advantage of the
platformâ€™s 3-D gallery environment may make sense.

3) Crytovoxels [https://www.cryptovoxels.com]
For those who want to create an NFT gallery in a pure metaverse environment,
Cryptovoxels is going to be a smart choice. Unlike the previous two entries,
Cryptovoxels is not solely dedicated to hosting NFT galleries. Instead,
Cyrtovoxels is an Ethereum based metaverse that allows the creation of NFT
galleries.

One of the big advantages of Crytovoxels is that the platform is free to use for
NFT gallery creators. However, there is an option to purchase a parcel of land
on the platform if you have a more extensive fanbase. With your own parcel of
land, you can have engineers custom build your own NFT gallery.

To get started with Crytovoxels, simply go to the siteâ€™s homepage and create a
free space. If you have a large following, you can also go to the homepage and
purchase a parcel of land.

Why use Cryptovoxels?
Because Cryptovoxels is more of an open metaverse community, you will likely
draw more visitors to your gallery. Also, the fact that this 3-D gallery is free
to use means that it will be much more beginner-friendly.

4). Decentraland [https://decentraland.org]
Decentraland is one of the largest metaverses platforms available and one of the
top places to create your own NFT art gallery. This Ethereum based metaverse
platform is already popular with NFT collectors and creators. In fact, the
auction house Sotheby's recently opened a virtual gallery on the platform. 

With Decentralnd, you can create your own NFT art gallery or you can have your
work displayed in one of the many already built galleries. The big advantage of
Decentraland is that it is already a popular destination for NFT collectors and
creators. Therefore, it is well worth your time to show off your work on this
platform. 

To get started with Decentraland, visit their homepage and connect your Ethereum
wallet. If you are not ready to open an NFT gallery or display your work, you
can always browse Decentraland as a guest.

Why choose Decentraland?
Decentraland is already popular with NFT creators and collectors. Therefore, you
are likely to find an audience right away on the platform. Also, you will have
the ability to either have your work displayed or create your own NFT gallery. 


5). Unstoppable Domains NFT Art Gallery [https://unstoppabledomains.com]
Unstoppable Domains is an NFT art gallery platform where you can replace crypto
addresses with domain names. This can make it easy for you to show off and
display your NFT collection. Now, Unstoppable Domains has gone one step further
by creating their own NFT gallery feature. When you purchase a domain, you will
be able to set up the NFT gallery feature and show off your collection. 

To get started, you will have to connect your Metamask wallet to their .crypto
domain. From there, purchase a domain that will connect to your NFTâ€™s crypto
address. From there, you will be able to set up your NFT galley.

Why choose Unstoppable Domains?
One of the biggest advantages of Unstoppable Domains is that you can create an
easily recognizable address to point people to your NFT gallery. Also, the
domain is inexpensive and there are no renewal fees. If you are looking to get
viewers from a social media post to your NFT gallery, then using Unstoppable
Domains is a smart choice.
Finding the Best NFT Gallery for Your Work
As you can see, there are a number of interesting virtual NFT gallery platforms
available. You may be interested in displaying your collection in one or more of
these NFT galleries. Also, you should consider displaying one or more of your
work on the Million Dollar Token Page [https://milliondollartokenpage.com/about]
.

Consider the pros and cons of each option before you commit any time or money
towards the creator of these galleries. Additionally, be sure to look out for
new NFT galleries that should emerge over the next few months. Chances are that
you will have many more options available as NFT galleries grow in popularity.

posts.html:
There has been a surge in the demand for crypto-collectibles and NFT art as a result of the growing popularity of non-fungible tokens (NFTs). Although the DeFi ecosystem has a wide range of uses, these are two of the most notable.

Non-fungible tokens are a fantastic fit for real-world assets, gaming, health care, and more because of their exclusivity and rarity. Due to this, we can anticipate more experimental use cases of NFTs as they evolve.

At the Million Dollar Token Page, weâ€™re going to explore some interesting NFT use cases and experimental ideas that are currently making waves.

But first, let's quickly introduce you to NFTs.

What are NFTs, and how are they used?

Non-fungible tokens, often known as NFTs, are unique digital assets that you can't swap with something else. They guarantee you the ownership of a digital asset when you buy one.

NFT transaction details are protected by a blockchain network. Theyâ€™ve paved the way for businesses and digital content providers alike to take advantage of new opportunities. As a result, the digital asset has emerged as a valuable medium for artists to share their work and earn money from it.

Million Dollar Token Page, a board to show, advertise and market NFT projects, and other popular sites like it allow NFT creators to display their art by purchasing pixel blocks of screen real estate. This is a great way to get the word out about your NFT project while also generating additional traffic.

NFTs can be used in a variety of fields due to their favourable characteristics and high-quality design. Because of this, the whole range of NFT applications varies greatly among various industries. As a follow-up, we'll take a look at some of the intriguing NFT use cases, as well as some experimental concepts that may become commonplace soon enough.

Popular NFT use cases & ideas

Hereâ€™s a list of 5 popular non-fungible token use cases:

Digital art

NFTs have been essential in resolving a major issue in the digital art industry: scarcity. NFTs help keep your artwork rare even though they can easily be reproduced and saved. Â And while there's a lot of phony art in the real world, we usually know how to tell them from real art.

Most of the value of NFT art idea comes from digitally validating its legitimacy and proprietorship. For example, a Bored Ape art can be copied from the Ethereum blockchain, but you cannot prove you possess the original if you don't.

Thereâ€™s so much more to NFTs than just the artwork that comes with them. Often, demonstrating ownership of a certain asset is more vital. In part because of this, digital art has become one of the most common use cases for NFTs in recent years.

Gaming

There is no better pairing than NFTs and gaming. NFTs can be used in video games if they can be accessed on several platforms. NFTs also allow game publishers to grow their brand and generate additional revenue streams.

Additionally, NFTs make in-game trading easy. Â Through this NFT idea, the blockchain allows for the instantaneous exchange of information between parties. This gives consumers the chance to buy firearms or other equipment that has been used and reviewed by other players.

A good example of this NFT use case is the integration of blockchain technology by several game publishers. In the spirit of PokÃ©mon Go, both Axie Infinity and Battle Pets feature a trading system for both pets and other in-game tokens. And if you want to trade these in-game tokens, you can easily do so on secondary marketplaces.

Access pass and memberships

NFTs can be used as access passes to exclusive events, merchandise, and experiences that would otherwise be out of reach to the general public. It's easy to swap an NFT access card for any other asset on the blockchain since it's fluid and unambiguous in its intent.

If you have a single wallet for all your subscriptions, you'll be able to keep track of them all. In this NFT use case, memberships may also be utilised to flaunt your affiliation with certain clubs and associations. As such, you can capitalise on your personal brand and reputation.

The Bored Ape Yacht Club is one of the most well-known instances of an NFT that permits membership access. As part of the BAYC NFT collection, you become a member of an elite swamp club of apes.

Fascinating, right? But that's not all.

You can also show off your assets on social media if you own a BAYC NFT. Several holders use their Bored Ape NFTs as their profile picture on Twitter. This also demonstrates the power of NFTs in promoting your individual brand.

Virtual fashion

The NFT market is becoming increasingly crowded with high-end and streetwear fashion brands. Weâ€™ll also use BAYC as an example of this NFT idea.

Bored Ape Yacht Club recently partnered with a high-end streetwear brand, The Hundreds, to produce merchandise for the surrounding community. All the merch sold out in a matter of hours. But this is just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to the potential use cases of NFTs in the fashion industry.

Luxury brands are also branching into the NFT sector. On September 30, 2020, Dolce & Gabbana's first nine-piece NFT collection, Collezione Genesi, went on sale. This collection was a peculiar blend of high fashion and blockchain technology that sold for $5.6 million. The collection included both real outfits and their NFT doubles.

Weeks before Collezione Genesi, a new firm named Auroboros revealed a collection of digital clothing that you can wear through augmented reality (AR).

As high fashion and blockchain come together, the fashion industry is in for a massive transformation. Â A new set of digital clothing will soon overtake industry aficionados as new technologies like NFTs and AR are combined with traditional couture techniques.

Finance

Thoughts of NFTs typically conjure up images of weird avatars, artworks, or collectible in-game objects. However, as use cases, NFTs have the potential to offer distinct financial advantages in the decentralised finance (DeFi) economy.

An example of an NFT idea is JustLiquidity's NFT staking model. The model allows you to earn an NFT for accessing the next pool when you invest a pair of tokens in a pool. When you join the next pool, the NFT works as an entry ticket and is discarded afterwards. In addition, you can trade this NFT pass on a secondary market.

More Top NFT ideas

Below is a list of some of the best NFT ideas that could become popular soon:

Health care

NFTs have the potential to become a major player in the healthcare sector. NFT ledgers can be used to store medical records without jeopardising privacy. It also prevents unauthorised access.

This is because NFT operations are confirmed on many nodes before being published to the blockchain. As such, all records are correct and safe against external interference.

Marketing

Advertising is not something that most people identify with NFTs. However, NFTs have paved a whole new marketing path for businesses.

Brands can use NFTs to identify unique methods of interacting with their audience, raise brand recognition, and generate new revenue streams.

Hereâ€™s an example of this NFT idea:

TacoBell provided 25 NFTs in 2021 to commemorate the return of potatoes to the menu. Consequently, they became the first fast-food business to embrace NFT. It took nothing less than a half-hour for all of the NFTs to be acquired.

One of the NFTs even sold for as high as $3,646. TacoBell pledged to donate all proceeds from the original sale, as well as from resales to its Live MÃ¡s Scholarship program.

Academia

NFTs can be used to demonstrate a student's academic accomplishments. Students can use NFTs as evidence of their participation in classes, their progress toward their degrees, and other relevant information.

An NFT ledger provides a safe place to save all of this information. If a student completes a course, they can be issued tokens, which are then verified by smart contract verification mechanisms.

There may be no more paper certificates in the future. Academic achievements will be recorded in the form of NFT tokens that may be transferred to other people, confirming that the holder of the token has acquired such an NFT.

Have other NFT use cases and ideas?

Now you see NFTs have a wide range of applications in both the digital and physical worlds. More concepts and applications for NFTs are likely to be explored in the future, given their expanding popularity.

Furthermore, NFT use cases can bring about performance improvements in several industries. However, not every NFT use case has had sufficient time to evolve beyond an intriguing notion or a modest side project. Some of these new NFT ideas may not pan out to be useful or even popular.

NFTs, on the other hand, are here to stay when it comes to more underlying and obvious challenges, such as the rarity of artworks and collectibles. And if you still want to stick to the digital art aspect of NFTs for now, thatâ€™s fine.

this, digital art has become one of the most common use cases for NFTs in recent
years.

Gaming

grow their brand and generate additional revenue streams.

blockchain allows for the instantaneous exchange of information between parties.

used and reviewed by other players.

Battle Pets feature a trading system for both pets and other in-game tokens. And
if you want to trade these in-game tokens, you can easily do so on secondary
marketplaces.

experiences that would otherwise be out of reach to the general public. It's
easy to swap an NFT access card for any other asset on the blockchain since it's
fluid and unambiguous in its intent.

track of them all. In this NFT use case, memberships may also be utilised to
flaunt your affiliation with certain clubs and associations. As such, you can
capitalise on your personal brand and reputation.
